actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with amendments and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 101-88.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 175.
Passed Senate with amendments and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the House.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Executive Comment Requested from USDA.
Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs discharged.
Mr. Udall asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent.
On passage Passed without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-184.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: An act to commemorate the contributions of Senator Clinton P. Anderson to the establishment of the National Wilderness Preservation System, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to rename Copperas Vista, located on the Gila National Forest in New Mexico, as the Senator Clinton P. Anderson Wilderness Overlook in commemoration of Senator Anderson's contribution to the National Wilderness Preservation System.

titles.title: A bill to authorize a study on methods to pay tribute to the late Senator Clinton P. Anderson of New Mexico for his significant contribution to the establishment of a national wilderness system.
An act to commemorate the contributions of Senator Clinton P. Anderson to the establishment of the National Wilderness Preservation System, and for other purposes.
